Posts.Content: On 10/30/2008 monique41 wrote: Hi, I had a lumpectomy last Friday and went for my post-op visit with the surgeon today.  He told me that the lymph nodes are clear of cancer but not all the tissue around the cancer in my left breast.  It is suppose to be a slow growing 1.5 cm. cancer.  I am completely shocked with the outcome. My husband and I could not believe the news, and I think the surgeon himself was a little surprised.  I am due for another surgery next week and hopefully radiation after that.  Has anyone out there had more than two lumpectomys????    I am 67 years old and still in shock.  Thanks for any info,  Monika          I am 64 years old had lymdectomy in 2000-clear lymphnodes cancer returned 2007-same size as first cancer 2-7cm this time they told me its hidden in scar-tissue-i don,t believe them i refuse to be cut open again. I am watching it i will go for my mamo every year if they say it grew .i will go for lazer treatments-meanwhile i eat healthy take vits-your cancer is still small explore your options-and please don't trust doctors-keep in mind there in it for money good luck               --Message edited by CancerCompass staff.
